questions.question: What is packet analysis?
questions.explanation: Analysis: examine packets. Tools: Wireshark, tcpdump. Purpose: troubleshooting, security. Captures: packets. Filtering: by protocol, IP, port. Importance: detailed diagnostic.

questions.question: What is Wireshark?
questions.explanation: Wireshark: GUI packet tool. Platform: cross-platform. Capture: network interfaces. Display: filters available. Analysis: detailed traffic view. Importance: standard tool.

questions.question: What is tcpdump?
questions.explanation: tcpdump: CLI tool. Platform: Linux/Unix. Capture: to file possible. Filters: BPF syntax. Output: text format. Power: flexible filtering. Importance: advanced analysis.

questions.question: What is a packet sniffer?
questions.explanation: Sniffer: passive capture. Purpose: analysis, troubleshooting, security. Tools: Wireshark, tcpdump, tshark. Limitation: sees only local traffic. Importance: diagnostic tool.

questions.question: What is a protocol analyzer?
questions.explanation: Analyzer: breaks down packets. Purpose: understand traffic. Layers: decodes all layers. Output: human-readable. Tool: Wireshark. Importance: analysis tool.

questions.question: What is packet loss?
questions.explanation: Loss: packets not delivered. Cause: congestion, errors. Measurement: percentage. Impact: performance degradation. Diagnosis: ping timeout. Importance: performance issue.

questions.question: What is latency?
questions.explanation: Latency: round-trip time. Measured: milliseconds. Impact: performance, user experience. Cause: distance, congestion. Tool: ping. Importance: performance metric.

questions.question: What is jitter?
questions.explanation: Jitter: latency varies. Problem: real-time applications. Cause: congestion, routing changes. Measurement: variance. Application: VoIP impacted. Importance: quality metric.

questions.question: What is bandwidth?
questions.explanation: Bandwidth: maximum data rate. Unit: Mbps, Gbps. Measurement: speed test. vs Throughput: actual vs theoretical. Bottleneck: limits performance. Importance: capacity metric.

questions.question: What is throughput?
questions.explanation: Throughput: real-world speed. vs Bandwidth: actual usage. Factors: congestion, interference, distance. Measurement: speed test. Importance: practical metric.
